Key Match Events: Mason Black allowed two runs over a career-high five innings in a 4-3 loss to the Marlins.
Griffin Conine hit a two-out, two-run blast off the right-field foul pole.
Connor Norby hit a leadoff homer in the sixth inning.
Tyler Fitzgerald's RBI single in the bottom half of the sixth inning.
Otto Lopez was awarded second base after a controversial obstruction call.
Michael Conforto blasted a solo shot in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Mason Black expressed satisfaction with his performance, stating it meant a lot to get his feet wet again and hopefully get more innings in the future.
Manager Bob Melvin commented that Black did his job, giving up only one homer over five innings.
Tyler Fitzgerald and Bob Melvin both criticized the obstruction call, with Fitzgerald stating he didn't think he was obstructing the runner.
